meanings.definition: A person who waits or remains in a certain place.
meanings.sent1: The biders at the bus stop were patiently waiting for the bus to arrive.
meanings.sent2: The group of biders outside the store were hoping to get the best deals.
meanings.sent3: The biders at the park were like statues, not moving an inch.
meanings.sent4: The biders in the library seemed to blend in with the shelves, almost becoming part of the books.
meanings.sent5: Among the biders in the queue, a young girl stood out with her bright red coat.

meanings.definition: To wait or remain in a certain place.
meanings.sent1: I will biders near the entrance until you arrive.
meanings.sent2: Please biders here while I go get the keys.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to biders by the window and watch the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The students had to biders quietly in the classroom during the surprise test.
meanings.sent5: The flowers will biders in the vase until the party starts.
